isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - FRONT DRIVE AXLE: SPICER S-9000 - STEERING KNUCKLE AND WHEEL END REASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: STEERING KNUCKLE AND WHEEL END REASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Use Figure 71 as a reference to reassemble steering knuckle and Figure 65 as a reference for wheel end reassembly.

step1.para: Install inner axle shaft bushing and seal (Items 6 and 7, Figure 75) into housing yoke bore.
Support shaft assembly and slide into axle housing and engage in differential side gear. Care should be taken when installing shaft as not to damage axle shaft oil seal.
Apply Loctite #518 to grease retainers. Install grease retainers and king pin bearing cups into housing yoke.
Install pregreased king pin bearing cones into cups.
Place original shims onto king pin studs ( Figure 84).

figure.caption: Figure 84. Shims Onto King Pin Studs

step1.para: Place knuckle in position over housing yoke ( Figure 85).
Install king pin bearing caps and locknuts. Tighten to 85 to 100 ft-lbs. (115 to 136 Nm) ( Figure 86).

figure.caption: Figure 86. Install Bearing Caps and Locking Nuts

step1.para: To check king pin bearing preload, turn knuckle all the way to the right. Place torque wrench onto nut of bearing cap. Rotate knuckle through complete turn angle. Torque reading should be 8 to 15 ft-lbs. ( Figure 87). Measurement is made less hub components, axle shaft, tie rod and steering cylinder. ( NOTE: Upon final assembly, an effort of 15 to 25 ft-lbs. is required.) To increase preload, remove shims from top or bottom king pin bearing. To decrease preload, add shims to top or bottom king pin bearing. Keep top and bottom shim packs as equal as possible.
Install steer arm/king pin assembly. New locknuts and stud adapters must be used. Tighten locknuts to 85 to 100 ft-lbs. (115 to 136 Nm) ( Figure 88).
Install spindle assembly, with bushing and seal in place, onto knuckle studs ( Figure 89).

figure.caption: Figure 89. Spindle Assembly Onto Knuckle Studs

step1.para: Install drum brake assembly onto knuckle studs. Assemble flat washers and locknuts onto studs and torque to 80 to 100 ft-lbs. (108 to 136 Nm) ( Figure 90).

figure.caption: Figure 90. Drum Brake Assembly Onto Knuckle Studs

step1.para: Assemble pregreased wheel bearings into hub and drum assembly. Install hub and drum assembly onto spindle. Install wheel bearing thrust washer and thread on inner adjusting nut while rotating hub. Hub should have .001 to .005 end play. Tighten nut to seat bearings, then back off 1/16 to 1/8 turn. Install lockwasher and bend tabs to lock adjusting nut into position. Install outer locknut and tighten, then bend tabs of lockwasher to hold outer locknut in position ( Figure 91).
Before assembling drive flange, turn knuckle to full turn stops. Install original shims ( Figure 92).
Install drive flange on hub and drum assembly studs. Tighten flange locknuts to 64 to 70 ft-lbs. (85 to 93 Nm) ( Figure 93).
Apply Loctite #277, or its equivalent, to bolt threads. Install socket head capscrew into center of drive flange. Back out 3/4 to 1 turn. Remove or add shims until hub rotates freely.

Install tie rod assembly. Tighten castellated nuts to 115 to 125 ft-lbs. (153 to 167 Nm). Advance nut to install cotter pin ( Figure 94). DO NOT BACK OFF THE CASTELLATED NUT TO INSTALL THE COTTER PIN.

With axle installed on vehicle, fill housing with proper lubricant to bottom of fill hole. Rotate differential and re-check level after 24 hours. Add lube as required to bottom of fill hole ( Figure 95).
